name: 6-(1-methylethyl)-3-phenyl-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,2,4]triazolo[3,4-b][1,3,5]thiadiazine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3630
Reason: Basic unit: Thiadiazine has an estimated base melting point around 200°C due to its high level of nitrogen and sulfur content which typically increase melting points due to strong intermolecular forces like dipole-dipole interactions and potential hydrogen bonding. Phenyl group: +15°C (increase in planarity and π-π stacking interactions). Isopropyl group (1-methylethyl): +10°C (increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces). Triazolo group: +5°C (enhanced polarity and possible hydrogen bonding).
Test (Predicted reason):
The basic unit for this compound is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The compound has several functional groups that will affect its melting point: - The presence of a triazine ring, which is a rigid and planar structure, will significantly increase the melting point due to its ability to engage in strong intermolecular interactions, estimated at +100°C. - The thiadiazine ring is another rigid and planar structure that can engage in strong intermolecular interactions, estimated at +70°C. - The methyl group attached to the phenyl ring will increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at +5°C. - The presence of a sulfur atom in the triazine ring can engage in hydrogen bonding, which would further increase the melting point, estimated at +10°C. - The presence of a nitrogen atom in the triazine ring can engage in hydrogen bonding, estimated at +5°C. - The presence of a phenyl group increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and pi-pi stacking interactions, estimated at +20°C. - The presence of a methyl group on the phenyl ring increases the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at +5°C.
